list_quotes.en: Computer Science is no more about computers than astronomy is about telescopes.
list_quotes.author: Edsger W. Dijkstra

list_quotes.en: The computing scientist’s main challenge is not to get confused by the complexities of his own making.
list_quotes.author: Edsger W. Dijkstra

list_quotes.en: If debugging is the process of removing software bugs, then programming must be the process of putting them in.
list_quotes.author: Edsger W. Dijkstra

list_quotes.en: A program is like a poem: you cannot write a poem without writing it. Yet people talk about programming as if it were a production process and measure „programmer productivity“ in terms of „number of lines of code produced“. In so doing they book that number on the wrong side of the ledger: We should always refer to „the number of lines of code spent“.
list_quotes.author: Edsger W. Dijkstra

list_quotes.en: There are two ways of constructing a software design: One way is to make it so simple that there are obviously no deficiencies, and the other way is to make it so complicated that there are no obvious deficiencies. The first method is far more difficult.
list_quotes.author: Tony Hoare

list_quotes.en: The best minds of my generation are thinking about how to make people click ads.
list_quotes.author: Jeff Hammerbacher

list_quotes.en: The tools we use have a profound and devious influence on our thinking habits, and therefore on our thinking abilities.
list_quotes.author: Edsger W. Dijkstra

list_quotes.en: How do we convince people that in programming simplicity and clarity — in short: what mathematicians call "elegance" — are not a dispensable luxury, but a crucial matter that decides between success and failure?
list_quotes.author: Edsger W. Dijkstra

list_quotes.en: Adding manpower to a late software project makes it later.
list_quotes.author: Fred Brooks
